author: Special Correspondent
text:
A special police team has arrested a four-member gang allegedly involved in a string of chain snatchings reported in various places in the city.

The team recovered stolen gold jewellery weighing around 25 sovereigns from the accused — one of whom was involved in a murder case.

Rising crime

Following recurring instances of chain snatchings in K.K. Nagar, Ponmalai, Airport, and Woraiyur areas, a special police team was constituted on the instruction of the Commissioner of Police Sanjay Mathur.

The team was led by Airport Inspector K. Kodilingam.

A police release here said the team arrested H. Paulraj (33), M. Navaladian (33), S. Senthil Kumar (33), and J. Sheikh Abdullah (35) on the charge of committing the offences. The release said all the four were sent to prison earlier for the offences committed before. Warrants were pending against Paulraj.
title: Gang involved in chain snatchings arrested
